definition: to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
scene/tableau/picture/image/screen (displayed by a computer)/(motion picture) frame/field of view
portrait/to do a portrait of sb

sentences.english: Thee sight of these pictures made me remember my own childhood.
sentences.chinese: 看到这幅画让我想到了我的童年时代。

sentences.english: Suppose I hold up a photograph of a beach with nobody on it.
sentences.chinese: 假设我拿着一张画着无人海滩的图片。

sentences.english: Scenes from the 17th century landscape paintings were replicated as Arcadian scenes.
sentences.chinese: 场景从17世纪景观作为田园场景复制画。

sentences.english: A black dress person into Cao Zhai night, stole Cao Fu a picture, and leave a mark.
sentences.chinese: 一黑衣人夜入曹宅，盗走曹父的一幅画，并留下记号。

sentences.english: Whenever sad time, god of destiny will be a silver pen on paper drawing a circle.
sentences.chinese: 每当悲伤一次，命运之神便会用银笔在纸上画一个圈。

sentences.english: The picture was hung on the line.
sentences.chinese: 在墙上显眼的地方挂着一幅画。

sentences.english: I haven't done many portraits, but I could paint landscapes in my sleep.
sentences.chinese: 我画的肖像画不多，但是我闭着眼也能画风景。

sentences.english: Life is life, fight for it!
sentences.chinese: 我们都是画中的生命呢。

sentences.english: Place your drawing over the transfer paper.
sentences.chinese: 把你的画放在转印纸上。

sentences.english: Rather, it conjures up a quiet and dutiful domesticity.
sentences.chinese: 但这幅画营造出一种安静祥和且各司其职的家庭生活。

sentences.english: JOANA: He paints better than anyone I know.
sentences.chinese: 他的画比我所认识的人画得都要好。

sentences.english: I do a little bit of pencil drawing myself in miniature.
sentences.chinese: 我自己会动手画一些微型铅笔画。

sentences.english: Their basic aim is to delight and instruct.
sentences.chinese: 这些画的底子目标是给人娱悦和教诲。

sentences.english: You can use it to draw anything.
sentences.chinese: 您可以使用它来画任何东西。

definition: to copy (a model of calligraphy or painting etc)
gongbi, traditional Chinese painting method characterized by meticulous brush technique and detailed description
freehand drawing or painting in traditional Chinese style
